title: Email Marketing - Fundamentals of Scaling Up Businesses from Scratch
headline: In this free online course, learn about the fundamentals of email marketing, including its impact & tools.
description: This free online course on email marketing is comprehensively designed for anyone beginning the journey of email marketing. As a beginner, you will learn various essential aspects of email marketing included in this course. You will learn about different categories of email marketing, techniques for segmenting emails, various online email market services, the process of email segmentation, and the use of autoresponders in email marketing.
courseDescription:
This free e-commerce course is specifically designed for beginners in email marketing. It begins with a brief introduction to email marketing, then proceeds to explain different email marketing categories, their advantages, disadvantages, and some of the best online email marketing services. This course has been designed so that the topics are linked and follow on from one another, making it easy to follow.

This comprehensive course is offered by Digital Partner, a pioneering agency dedicated to digital marketing, project management, online marketing, content marketing and various other categories that make e-commerce ventures successful. It lists the four simple steps to create effective and interesting autoresponders, and discusses the different ways in which you can improve email open rates. This course will also help you to learn the vital progress of email segmentation and illustrates how autoresponders can be deployed for automated email marketing practices. 

The topics in this course cover all the essentials: the basics of starting email marketing, different types of emails used in email marketing, best email marketing services, A/B testing, and the process of email segmentation. A short assessment is given at the end of every topic, which will help you reinforce your newly acquired knowledge. The course also contains a summary at the end where you can review all the important information you have gained.

Start Course Now

slides:
• Learning Outcomes

  • Having completed this module you will be able to:

    • Discuss different categories of email marketing.
    • Compare advantages and disadvantages of email marketing categories.
    • Explain the importance of email marketing for businesses.
    • Analyze lead magnet and its role in email enhancement.
    • Outline the process of creating a highly converting email form.
    • Identify various types of online email marketing service providers.
    • Define email autoresponders.
    • Discuss the reasons for using email autoresponders.
    • Identify the steps of creating an effective email autoresponder.
    • Identify the process of email segmentation.
    • Classify email autoresponders into various categories.
    • Outline the process of improving email rates.

  • What is Email Marketing?

  • Select an Image from the Gallery

  • Email marketing refers to sending a commercial message to a group of people via email as a commercial activity. In email marketing, emails can be used to request donations, advertisement, and sales soliciting, etc.

  • Different Types of Email Marketing

  • There are various types of emails that are used in email marketing. These are:
    • Welcome Emails
    • Dedicated Emails
    • Sponsorship Emails
    • Lead Nurturing Emails
    • Email Newsletters
    • Reengagement Emails

  • What is Email Segmentation?

  • Select an Image from the Gallery

  • It is a process by which subscribers of an organization are divided into small groups according to specific criteria. This allows the organization to send more relevant and personalized emails to their customers. Segmentation allows sending emails to a specific population of subscribers interested in particular content, thus resulting in more conversions.

  • Using Autoresponders For Email Marketing

  • Select an Image from the Gallery

  • Autoresponder can be defined as a series of emails that are automatically sent to a segment of subscribers. This autoresponder is activated via particular triggers. For example, if someone joins the subscriber list, there is a cart abandonment, a PDF has been downloaded, a product has been bought, or someone has shown a particular browsing behavior.
    The email content of the autoresponder is created in advance. Its setup is created to be sent at an appropriate time with the assistance of the organization's email marketing software

  • Lesson Summary

    • Email marketing refers to sending a commercial message to a group of people via email as a commercial activity. 
    • Welcome emails are considered ideal for introducing the organization and relationship building.
    • Dedicated emails are also known as stand-alone emails, and they contain information only about what they can offer.
    • Sponsorship emails are ideal for creating new leads and reaching a new target audience.
    • Lead nurturing emails consist of tightly connected emails that have purposeful content.
    • Email newsletters are considered as ideals for educating the organization's audience about its business. It also helps the organizations in illustrating their employees' profiles and various projects.
    • Re-engagement emails are optimal for getting reconnected and re-establishing the contacts with the existing customers. One such way is to ask those customers about the feedback.
    • Importance of Email Marketing:
      1. Reliable and frequently used communication platform.
      2. The user has complete access to his email, no risk of account deletion.
      3. Email promos are three times more effective than social media and other means.
